availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John A. Blackburn (Union County, Tennessee, farmer and corporal (U.S.A.))

body.p: Union County, Tennessee, farmer and soldier. Tennessee native. Son of Thomas Blackburn and Polly Blackburn. Father of Jemina Blackburn. Married to Rebecca Blackburn. Farmer in Grainger County, Tennessee in 1850. Farm laborer in Grainger County, Tennessee in 1860. Served in Twelfth Tennessee Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as corporal from July 8, 1863 to September 7, 1865. Juror in the State V. William B. Chapman.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Grainger County, District 13, p. 227.Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Grainger County, District 12, p. 511.Enumerating Union Veterans and Widows of Union Veterans of the Civil War (1890), Special Schedules of the Eleventh Census, Grainger County, District 13, p. 1. KYR-0001-021-0031.
